attributes.action: Investigate the irresponsible COVID-19 reporting by the UK Press.
attributes.additional_details: The UK media has consistently sought to sensationalise all aspects of the COVID-19 emergency which has exasperated people’s feeling of fear / panic, and sought to undermine Government’s efforts to chart a pragmatic path through the situation.  The media has used inaccurate / false reporting (See HMG response to the Sunday Times Insight article) which has had a detrimental effect on the UK’s morale, adversely affected national cohesiveness and further undermined trust in the UK Press Corps.
attributes.background: Parliament / Government shall establish an independent inquiry into the irresponsible and panic-inducing behaviour and the misrepresentative reporting which the UK media (of all types) has undertaken during the COVID-19 national emergency.

rejection.details:
Complaints about the press are the responsibility of the Independent Press Standards Organisation (IPSO), not  the Government or Parliament. 

You might like to sign one or more of these petitions:

Criminalise the publication of unfounded false statements by the media
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/303050 

Ensure balance and fairness in political reporting
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/300700 

Corrections and clarifications in UK media to be as prominent as original story
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/300557
